meanings.definition: A strong desire or craving for food.
meanings.sent1: Her appetites were satisfied after a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: Children often have big appetites and enjoy snacks.
meanings.sent3: His appetites for pizza and ice cream never seem to end!
meanings.sent4: The appetites of the lions in the zoo roared to life at feeding time.
meanings.sent5: The appetites of the guests were whetted by the aroma of the cooking.

meanings.definition: A strong desire or liking for something.
meanings.sent1: His appetites for adventure led him to explore new places.
meanings.sent2: She had an insatiable appetites for reading books.
meanings.sent3: Their appetites for fun and excitement knew no bounds.
meanings.sent4: The appetites of the crowd for entertainment were finally satisfied.
meanings.sent5: The appetites of the audience for a good story were met by the talented storyteller.

meanings.definition: The natural instinctive desire for food.
meanings.sent1: Animals in the wild have strong appetites to hunt for food.
meanings.sent2: The baby's appetites for milk were always met by the mother.
meanings.sent3: The appetites of the bear woke up after hibernation.
meanings.sent4: The appetites of the birds in spring are focused on building nests.
meanings.sent5: The appetites of the chef were evident in the delicious dishes served.
